result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua James Coty

records.addlTxt:
4:00 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy Defendant Joshua James Coty in court.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.   Originally set for a Preliminary hearing. Atty Ellenwood updates the court.  Atty Larimore is the attorney on DE's other case.  Atty Larimore appeared at the last hearing but it appears he has not been appointed at this time.  Court will set for a STC.  DE will follow up with Atty Larimore. Court will also follow up with Atty Larimore. Court confirms address.  Bond continues.  Adjourned: 4:05
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Per EFV. arc fax: Dispatch, Jail & SCSO.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.C..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:31 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore appeared by video for Joshua James Coty. Defendant Joshua James Coty in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Court quashed warrant. Court sets PH with TCH. Adjourned 01:38 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
SIGNED by EFV on 10/18/22. e: DA. bph
Proposed WA filed by DA. bph
